# Small scripts for visualization

This will create plots in the same form as in the paper. You enter in the data frame name and cell type as either "A", "B", or "D".

```{r}
BAD_plots <- function(df, cell_type){
  if (cell_type == "A"){
    voltage <- df %>% 
      ggplot(aes(Time, one_va)) +
      geom_path() +
      labs(x = "Time (ms)",
           y = "Vm (mV)")
    calcium <- df %>% 
      ggplot(aes(Time, one_ca)) +
      geom_path() +
      labs(x = "Time (ms)",
           y = expression(paste("C (", mu, "M)")))
    hormone <- df %>% 
      ggplot(aes(Time, one_G)) +
      geom_path() +
      labs(x = "Time (ms)",
           y = "G (pM)")
    ggarrange(voltage, calcium, hormone)
  } else if (cell_type == "B"){
    voltage <- df %>% 
      ggplot(aes(Time, one_vb)) +
      geom_path() +
      labs(x = "Time (ms)",
           y = "Vm (mV)")
    calcium <- df %>% 
      ggplot(aes(Time, one_c)) +
      geom_path() +
      labs(x = "Time (ms)",
           y = expression(paste("C (", mu, "M)")))
    hormone <- df %>% 
      ggplot(aes(Time, one_I)) +
      geom_path() +
      labs(x = "Time (ms)",
           y = "I (pM)")
    ggarrange(voltage, calcium, hormone)
  } else {
    voltage <- df %>% 
      ggplot(aes(Time, one_vd)) +
      geom_path() +
      labs(x = "Time (ms)",
           y = "Vm (mV)")
    calcium <- df %>% 
      ggplot(aes(Time, one_cd)) +
      geom_path() +
      labs(x = "Time (ms)",
           y = expression(paste("C (", mu, "M)")))
    hormone <- df %>% 
      ggplot(aes(Time, one_S)) +
      geom_path() +
      labs(x = "Time (ms)",
           y = "S (pM)")
    ggarrange(voltage, calcium, hormone)
  }
}
```
